reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We fancied a romantic weekend Autumn break near Stratford and the Mary Arden Inn was the perfect location. It's a very pretty old pub with nice bar and a welcoming fire in a picturesque village outside of Stratford.
reviews.title: Perfect for a romantic break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The four-poster room we stayed in was nicely decorated in repro tudor in keeping with the Shakespearian theme of the location and very comfortable. The staff were very accomodating and friendly.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the bar - as one other reviewer commented the separate restaurant area was deserted - but there were plenty of people eating in the bar and it had a lovely cosy atmosphere. The food is pretty good modern pub food with a well thought-out simple menu.
reviews.title: very good

likes.disliked: — bedroom walls are a little thin

reviews.text: The Mary Arden is super easy to find if you're travelling up late on a Friday as we were as it's right next to Mary Arden's house (unsurprisingly!), so the village is well signposted; and it's close to all the sight-seeing places including Stratford itself and Anne Hathaway's Cottage.
reviews.title: A wonderful place - but somewhat lacking in atmosphere

likes.disliked: — Too modern for a traditional inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I was being picky, I'd say that the breakfast wasn't the absolute best I'd ever had in B&B, although it was perfectly fine.
reviews.title: Fab place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic quiet location, easy to get to Stratford and Warwick, obviously both well worth a visit (although beware of Warwick Castle, extremely expensive). Set in a pretty little village with another pub just up the road and a local convenience store a couple of minutes walk away. Mary Arden's House and farm is virtually opposite and definitely worth visiting.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location

reviews.text: We stopped two nights in room 10 (Winter's Tale room). Room was spacious, well equiped and spotlessly clean. Only fault was the bed which was extremely hard and not at all comfortable and if we stop again I would ask for a different room.
reviews.title: Awful service and equally awful food - Shakepseare with Attitude!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best asset that the inn has got is without doubt the staff. All were extremely friendly and efficient which always makes a stay extra special. They were rushed off their feet at times but still managed to have a smile for everyone and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Home from (Shakespeare's) home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant both nights and the food was excellent, fresh and well cooked and served piping hot. The menu was a little limited and more choice would have been welcome. Afterwards we sat in the bar, very relaxing and a nice way to end the evening.
reviews.title: what a great place for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst visiting Mary Arden's House and Stratford upon Avon our eyes fell upon an idyllic looking pub come B & B, right on Mary Arden's doorstep, a prime location for a thriving business one might think..........................well we were sadly very disillusioned!
reviews.title: Great value location for Stratford

reviews.text: The location was excellent and easy to find. The welcome from the young bar staff was warm and extremely friendly. All meals taken at the warm(open log fire) bar were excellent and good value, with very professional service from the young boys. Both couples(we visited with friends) had well appointed four poster bedrooms. Each bedroom however, had a problem - lack of heating in the bathroom of one (King Lear) and a scaldingly hot shower (we were unable to get any cold water through) in the other(Merchant of Venice). On reporting these to the management the response was "the last guests didn't complain". A small portable heater was provided for the one room but the. problem was not rectified or explained in the other.. The manager and his wife( we understand they have only taken over in the last month) seemed totally indifferent to the needs of their guests as was exemplified when there was a power cut on the last evening. No conversation, let alone explanation was forthcoming, until two small tealights on a saucer were thrust into our hands and we were left to cope with getting to our rooms, without a word of concern or apology. Overall lovely location, lovely hotel- shame about the management.
reviews.title: Lovely break - shame about the managers

likes.liked: — Great four poster bed and good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the reviews we were looking forward to our stay at The Mary Arden Inn but unfortunately it did not live up to expectations. This Inn is set in a lovely little village and could be a real asset to the area especially being located so close to such a big visitor attraction as Mary Arden House.
reviews.title: First visit to Stratford

likes.disliked: — VERY OUTDATED DECOR AND POOR FOOD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very pleasant but the whole place is in need of extensive refurbishment. Most of the decor is quite outdated and lacks inspiration the en-suite in our room could only be described as functional.
reviews.title: What a fantastic place to stay - can't wait to go back!!

likes.liked: — The general feel of the place, staff and locaton
likes.disliked: — I couldn't pick one thing I didn't like - it was perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the bar and our starters were quite nice but my rib-eye steak was just edible, very disapointing. The beer also left something to be desired. On the plus side breakfast was very nice.
reviews.title: Super, friendly and clean !

reviews.text: It was a shame as the staff were very pleasant , good location but, the place itself certainly lacks atmosphere and inspiration.
reviews.title: Superb friendly hotel.
Had a fabulous stay !
reviews.text: Would just like to say what a brilliant weekend we had (despite the weather!) and the Mary Arden Inn was a perfect choice to stay at ...the rooms were immaculate and the bar/restaurant were terrific (lovely breakfast!)
